The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Death's Office
Death's Office
Released25 June 2020 (Update)
MembersNo
LocationNone
MusicRest in Peace
Map

Death's Office, also known as Death's Domain, is a small office in which Death resides. The entrance to Death's Office can be found near any major respawn point, indicated by a tombstone icon on the minimap:

  • Lumbridge - graveyard by the church
  • Falador - White Knights' Castle Crypt
  • Seers' Village - graveyard by the church
  • Edgeville - mausoleum
  • Ferox Enclave
  • Kourend Castle
  • Prifddinas - Hefin district, north of the bank.

In Death's office, players can collect items that they did not collect from their grave within 15 minutes of dying. Items worth less than 100,000 are free to reclaim, but items worth more come with a 5% reclamation fee, while graves have a 1% reclamation fee. As with graves, ironmen (with the exception of ultimate ironmen) are given a 50% discount, giving them a 2.5% and 0.5% reclamation fee respectively. Items may be collected at Death's office before the 15 minute time has run out, although the cost is still higher.

Players may deposit unwanted items into the Death's coffer for 105% of the item's Grand Exchange price (item has to be worth more than 10,000 gp to be acceptable), which will be used to pay for item reclamation fees. Items offered here cannot be withdrawn and the value cannot be used for any other purpose.

Death can be talked to in order to cosmetically enhance the player's gravestone to a statue of an angel, costing 200,000.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Mithril seeds cannot be used in Death's Office. Attempting to do so results in the message You can't plant your flowers here. appearing in chat. Previously it said Pretty flowers won't cheer this place up. instead.
  • The Siren's tome, an item which passed a poll but scrapped afterward, can be seen behind Death's desk.
The Siren's tome, visible behind Death's desk.

'''Death's Office''', also known as '''Death's Domain''', is a small office in which [[Death (NPC)|Death]] resides. The entrance to Death's Office can be found near any major [[respawn]] point, indicated by a tombstone icon [[File:Death's Office icon.png]] on the minimap: 
* [[Lumbridge]] - graveyard by the church
* [[Falador]] - [[Crypt (White Knights' Castle)|White Knights' Castle Crypt]]
* [[Seers' Village]] - graveyard by the church
* [[Edgeville]] - [[Edgeville Mausoleum|mausoleum]]
* [[Ferox Enclave]]
* [[Kourend Castle]]
* [[Prifddinas]] - [[Prifddinas#Hefin district|Hefin district]], north of the bank.

In Death's office, players can collect items that they did not collect from their [[grave]] within 15 minutes of [[death|dying]]. Items worth less than {{Coins|100000}} are free to reclaim, but items worth more come with a 5% reclamation fee, while graves have a 1% reclamation fee. As with graves, [[Ironman Mode|ironmen]] (with the exception of ultimate ironmen) are given a 50% discount, giving them a 2.5% and 0.5% reclamation fee respectively. Items may be collected at Death's office before the 15 minute time has run out, although the cost is still higher.

Players may deposit unwanted items into the [[Death's coffer]] for 105% of the item's [[Grand Exchange]] price (item has to be worth more than 10,000 gp to be acceptable), which will be used to pay for item reclamation fees. Items offered here '''cannot''' be withdrawn and the value cannot be used for any other purpose.

Death can be talked to in order to cosmetically enhance the player's [[gravestone]] to a statue of an angel, costing {{coins|200000}}.

==Trivia==
* [[Mithril seeds]] cannot be used in Death's Office. Attempting to do so results in the message {{RSFont|You can't plant your flowers here.}} appearing in chat. Previously it said {{RSFont|Pretty flowers won't cheer this place up.}} instead.
* The [[Siren's tome]], an item which passed a poll but scrapped afterward, can be seen behind [[Death (NPC)|Death]]'s desk.
[[File:Siren's tome in Death's Office.png|thumb|left|The Siren's tome, visible behind Death's desk.]]
